com.googlecode.n_orm.hbase

Class TableLocker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.n_orm.hbase.TableLocker

  • public class TableLocker
extends Object
    A zookeeper-based read write lock for protecting table schemas operations. Read lock can be promoted to write lock ; in this latter case write unlock brings back read lock. Uses the "/n-orm/schemalock/" directory at the zookeeper level.
    For a given thread, locks can be acquired a reentrant way. However, they must be released in the reversed order the've been acquired. As an example, a thread can perform the following scenario:
    1. sharedLockTable (actually gets a shared lock here)
    2. sharedLockTable
    3. exclusiveLockTable (actually releases the shared lock and then gets an exclusive lock here)
    4. sharedLockTable
    5. exclusiveLockTable
    6. exclusiveUnlockTable (cannot call sharedUnlockTable here)
    7. sharedUnlockTable
    8. exclusiveUnlockTable (actually releases the exclusive lock and then gets a shared lock here)
    9. sharedUnlockTable
    10. sharedUnlockTable (actually releases the shared lock here)

    It is enforced that if a thread holds an exclusive lock, an exclusive lock is acquired at the zookeeper level ; otherwise, if there is a thread that holds a shared lock, a shared lock is acquired at the zookeeper level ; otherwise, no lock is held from zookeeper.
